column5: I wear my snowmobile parka in the winter. It has super reflective piping on the seams and really shines when hit by lights.

I quit wearing my favorite snowmobile jacket and got a new one because it didn't have reflective piping on it. Got thinking about if I was broke down on the trail with no lights on the sled.  When somebody comes ripping around a corner at 60mph I want them to see me

I'm a careful driver. Not a speed demon. No accidents. This evening I'm in an intersection in the dark waiting  to turn left.  It's raining. I begin my turn. Last minute I see an older woman. Dressed entirely in black. With a black purse. Black umbrella tipped towards me. Crossing the street to my left. Right in my path. Didn't see her at all thru the rain covered door window. I heard several pedestrians were hit in TO early this morning. I'm not surprised.
Buncha people got mowed down this morning probably for the same reason.
What the....  Glad you didnt hit anyone  Whats with the all black garb???
All in black you say? She's a witch, hit her!
She could be a Greek or Macedonian widow, they wear black for years after their husbands die.
and here in Wasaga Beach they walk on the wrong side of the road to boot! And, no they are not all widows of any description!!
Buncha people got mowed down this morning probably for the same reason.  Yep, 16 got hit this morning.

One just got killed at Steels and Albion.  It was scary yesterday between Bathurst and Bayview along Center/John street with  a full canopy of trees and the lights burried in the branches, never went over 35.

Same thing here this morning; halfway through making a left turn; this woman on a bike, riding on the sidewalk came out of nowhere. She was all in dark colours, no light or reflectors on the bike. I had more then enough time to avoid hitting her; but I get the finger from her??? OK lets count the number of things you did wrong lady!  Dan.
